sourceDesc.bibl: Iamata A, IG IV² 121; translation from Attalus.org

div.head: 1. Cleo
div.p: Cleo, who was pregnant for five years, came as a suppliant to the god and slept in the abaton. As soon as she left the temple precinct, she gave birth to a boy who, immediately, washed himself at the fountain and walked around with his mother.

div.head: 2. Ithmonika
div.p: Ithmonika of Pellene, pregnant for three years, came to the sanctuary to conceive a child. ... (full text)

div.head: 3. Euhippos
div.p: Euhippos, a man from Aegion who was mute from birth... (full text).

div.head: 4. Hermodikos
div.p: Hermodikos of Lampsacus, suffering from paralysis ... (full text).
